intro: Malacocarpus fricii, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Malacocarpus fricii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
